intro: Coenoemersa, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Coenoemersa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and attractive foliage.
